verses.text: 在你壯年的日子，當記念你的創造主。不要等到衰敗的日子，就是你所說：「我毫無喜樂」的那些年日臨到，

words.note: Precedes a verb to form a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which is said'.
A poetic term for time, especially a long duration.

verses.text: 日頭、光明、月亮、星宿變暗，雨後烏雲再現的時候。

words.note: Refers to celestial bodies, often poetic or archaic.

verses.text: 那時，看守房子的發抖，強壯的彎腰，推磨的稀少，都停了工，往窗外看的都昏暗了，

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase, e.g., 'those who guard'.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding adjective, e.g., 'the strong ones'.
Refers to the traditional manual activity of grinding grain.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase, e.g., 'those who grind'.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase, e.g., 'those who look'.

verses.text: 當街的門口關閉，推磨的聲音微弱。雀鳥一叫，人就起來。唱歌的歌聲（「歌聲」原文作「女子」）都低微。

words.note: Refers to the traditional manual activity of grinding grain.
Often refers to small, chirping birds.
Used in '一...就...' structure to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase, e.g., 'the singers'.
Describes something soft, weak, or barely audible.

verses.text: 人怕高處，怕路上有驚嚇。杏樹開花，蚱蜢蹣跚而行，催情果失效。因為人歸他永遠的家，哭喪的在街上遊行。

words.note: Often describes an unsteady, faltering walk.
Refers to the caperberry, historically believed to be an aphrodisiac, mentioned in Ecclesiastes.
Refers specifically to wailing and grieving for the deceased.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase, e.g., 'the mourners'.

verses.text: 銀鍊斷掉，金碗破裂，瓶子在泉旁破碎，打水的輪子在井邊破爛。

words.note: Verb-object compound: 'to hit/draw water'

verses.text: 塵土要歸回原來之地，靈要歸回賜靈的 神。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive particle, equivalent to modern '的'.
In a spiritual or life-force sense here.
The space '　' denotes reverence in some Chinese Bible translations.

verses.text: 傳道者說：「虛空的虛空，一切都是虛空。」

words.note: Refers to the author/persona of the book of Ecclesiastes.
A key theme in Ecclesiastes.
Repetition emphasizes profound emptiness.

verses.text: 結論：敬畏 神，謹守誡命傳道者不但有智慧，還將知識教訓眾人；他既揣摩，又查考，也編撰了許多箴言。

words.note: Often used in religious context meaning 'fear of God'.
The space '　' denotes reverence in some Chinese Bible translations.
Here refers to the role/person, not necessarily the book title itself.
Similar to '把', indicating the object of the verb.
Used in the '既...又...' structure meaning 'both...and...'

verses.text: 傳道者搜尋可喜悅的話，正確地寫下真理。

words.note: Lit. 'can be joyful/pleasing'.
Indicates manner, forming an adverb from an adjective.

verses.text: 智慧人的言語像刺棒，他們所彙集的箴言像釘牢的釘子，都是一位牧者所賜的。

words.note: A pointed stick used to drive animals.
Refers to the Book of Proverbs or wise sayings.
Often refers to pastors or spiritual leaders in Christianity.
Formal verb often used for divine or royal gifts.

verses.text: 我兒，還有，你當受勸勉：著書多，沒有窮盡；讀書多，身體疲倦。

words.note: Used as an address: 'My son'.

verses.text: 你們一切都聽見了，總而言之，應當敬畏 神，謹守他的誡命，因為這是每一個人的本分。

words.note: A common idiom meaning 'to sum it up'.
To show reverent fear, especially toward God.
Often capitalized and indented in Bibles to show reverence.

verses.text: 人所作的每一件事，連一切隱藏的事，無論是善是惡， 神都必審問。

words.note: Often capitalized and indented in Bibles to show reverence.
Implies a formal inquiry or judgment.
